New Records: Virat Kohli scored 103 runs off 97 balls, the fastest century in ODI history
India won the match by 7 wickets, their highest margin in the World Cup since 2013
Key Match Events: Virat Kohli's century was the highest score by an Indian in ODIs since 2013
Ravindra Jadeja took 2 wickets and scored 38 runs, a significant all-round performance
Jasprit Bumrah took 2 wickets for 14 runs in his 10 overs
Post-Match Reflections: Virat Kohli expressed relief at the win, mentioning it as a crucial boost for the team's morale
The match win was significant for India's World Cup campaign, breaking a long drought
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played under lights in Pune, with a 50-over format
Bangladesh's top scorer was Litton Das with 66 runs
The match flow showed key powerplays and partnerships
Others: The match was part of the 2023-24 World Cup, India's first win in the tournament
DRS stats showed key decisions impacting the game
